info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 05 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Dutchess and Ulster Counties in New York, and Litchfield County in Connecticut. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall and embedded thunderstorms will continue through Tuesday morning across the watch area. Rainfall rates will generally be 0.25 to 0.75 inches per hour, but may exceed an inch per hour through this evening briefly if any thunderstorms develop. Storm total rainfall of 3 to 4 inches, locally up to 5 inches, is expected. This amount of rainfall could lead to urban and poor drainage flooding and possibly isolated flash flooding if repeated rounds of heavy rainfall occur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
